solution_line_template: They bought {num_pineapples} pineapples for ${pineapple_price} apiece so {num_pineapples}*{pineapple_price} = $<<{num_pineapples}*{pineapple_price}={total_pineapple_cost}>>{total_pineapple_cost}

The pineapples cost ${total_pineapple_cost} and it will cost ${shipping_cost} to ship so all total, it costs {total_pineapple_cost}+{shipping_cost} = $<<{total_pineapple_cost}+{shipping_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}

In total it costs ${total_cost} to ship home a dozen pineapples so each pineapple costs {total_cost}/{num_pineapples} = $<<{total_cost}/{num_pineapples}={cost_per_pineapple}>>{cost_per_pineapple} apiece
